definition: to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: This time, however, Chinese authorities in Hebei Province stepped forward and stopped the deal.
sentences.chinese: 但这一次，河北省的地方政府插手并阻止了这一交易。

sentences.english: You'd feel the same way if someone was horning in on your work.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人插手你的工作，你也会有同样的感觉的。

sentences.english: Again the Prince of Orange intervened, and told the university not to be silly.
sentences.chinese: 奥伦治公再一次插手干涉，叫来顿大学休要无知。

sentences.english: Why I always feel as if someone are horning in on my work?
sentences.chinese: 为何我总感觉好像有人插手我的工作？

sentences.english: We provided job training for 1 million urban and rural workers.
sentences.chinese: 全年组织100万城乡劳动者插手职业培训。

sentences.english: I think Apple wanted in on that market.
sentences.chinese: 我认为苹果想要插手这一市场。

sentences.english: The colonists' base will be over-run in a matter of minutes. Shall we intervene?
sentences.chinese: 殖民基地在数分钟之内就会被攻下，我们该插手了吗？

sentences.english: You know, like I said, I don't want to meddle.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，就像我之前说的，我不想插手这件事。

sentences.english: I hope this is the first of mexcellentygarees with the teare.
sentences.chinese: 我盼望这是我跟随队伍插手角逐的早先。

sentences.english: We oppose interference by any outside force.
sentences.chinese: 我们反对任何外来势力插手干预。

sentences.english: She hated America too, because it always meddled in the affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 她也讨厌美国人，因为他们总是插手其他国家的事务。

sentences.english: In return, FDR offered to stop interfering in Asian affairs altogether.
sentences.chinese: 作为回报，罗斯福答应完全不再插手亚洲事务。

sentences.english: You rememprover her from my celebrine two years ago?
sentences.chinese: 还记得她吗？两年前插手过我的寿辰派对。

sentences.english: Beijing also senses US overextension and sensitivity to Chinese provocations (broadly defined).
sentences.chinese: 北京也意识到美国在中国问题上的过度插手和敏感。

sentences.english: What happened ? Science ----or what is called scicence ---stepped in .
sentences.chinese: 后来怎么样了呢？科学或所谓的科学一一插手进来。

sentences.english: Before Roughead came in, you had an absolute catastrophe in procurement.
sentences.chinese: 在拉夫黑德插手前，购买船只绝对是场大的灾难。

definition: to show an interest in/to get involved with
not to get involved/to stay out of it
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
